## What does a computer do

## Whatâ€™s an algorithm

&emsp; 1. A sequence of simple steps  
&emsp; 2. A control flow to manage which step to execute  
&emsp; 3. A stopping condition  


## Simple example

&emsp; Worth of an investment of 10k\$ after 3 years at 5% interest rate?  
&emsp; Compute the value for simple and compounded rates  

```{pyodide-python}
```


## Breaking down the code

```{.python code-line-numbers="1|2|3|4|5|9|10-12|13"}
principal = 10000
rate = 5 / 100
simple = False
compounded = True
if simple:
    investment_value_after_1yr = principal*(1+rate)
    investment_value_after_2yr = investment_value_after_1yr + principal*rate
    investment_value_after_3yr = investment_value_after_2yr + principal*rate
if compounded:
    investment_value_after_1yr = principal*(1+rate)
    investment_value_after_2yr = investment_value_after_1yr*(1+rate)
    investment_value_after_3yr = investment_value_after_2yr*(1+rate)
print(investment_value_after_3yr)
```

## A computer programm

&emsp; Set of instructions stored inside computer  
&emsp; Built with predefined primitive instructions (arithmetic, moving data, etc.)  

&emsp; A special program translates instructions to machine-readable language  
&emsp; Programmers say: "the interpreter compiles the program"

## Programming languages (1)

&emsp; A programming language is a set of readable shorthands  
&emsp; To primitive operations and more...

&emsp; Common languages are equivalent  
&emsp; But some are more suited to certain tasks  


## Programming languages (2)

&emsp; Syntax is important!  
&emsp;&emsp; In English: "cat dog boy", not valid, but "cat hugs boy" is valid  
&emsp;&emsp; In Python: "hi"5, not valid, but "3.2*5" is valid

&emsp; Contrary to natural languages, statements have only one meaning  
&emsp; But may not be what programmer intended  
&emsp;&emsp; program crashes  
&emsp;&emsp; program runs forever  
&emsp;&emsp; program gives a surprising answer

## Arithmetic operators {#sec-app-arithmetic}

&emsp; [[Back to main]{.button}](#sec-arithmetic)

| Operator | Symbol | Description                          | Example         | Result |
|----------|--------|--------------------------------------|-----------------|--------|
| Addition | `+`    | Adds two operands                    | `3 + 2`         | `5`    |
| Subtraction | `-` | Subtracts right operand from left    | `5 - 3`         | `2`    |
| Multiplication | `*` | Multiplies two operands           | `4 * 2`         | `8`    |
| Division | `/`    | Divides left operand by right       | `10 / 2`        | `5.0`  |
| Floor Division | `//` | Divides and returns integer part | `10 // 3`       | `3`    |
| Modulus | `%`     | Returns remainder of division       | `10 % 3`        | `1`    |
| Exponentiation | `**` | Raises left operand to power of right | `2 ** 3`   | `8`    |
